ARABIC: وَوَهَبْنَا لَهُم مِّن رَّحْمَتِنَا وَجَعَلْنَا لَهُمْ لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ عَلِيًّا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We endowed them with Our mercy and made them highly honoured.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And bestowed on them some of Our blessings, and gave them high renown.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and We bestowed on them Our mercy, and granted them a truly lofty renown.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We granted them Our blessing and high renown.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And We gave them Our mercy, and assigned for them a true and high repute.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And We gave them of Our mercy, and We granted them Sidqin `Aliyyan on the tongues.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And We granted to them of Our mercy, and We left (behind them) a truthful mention of eminence for them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and We gave them of Our mercy, and We appointed unto them a tongue of truthfulness, sublime.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And we gave them of Our mercy, and assigned to them a high and true renown.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We granted them Our mercy and bestowed on them true and high renown.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And We bestowed on them of Our mercy, and We made for them a renown lofty.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And We gave them out of Our mercy, and conferred on them a worthy and lofty repute.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And We bestowed of Our Mercy on them, and We granted them lofty honour on the tongue of truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And We gave them of Our Mercy (a good provision in plenty), and We granted them honour on the tongues (of all the nations, i.e. everybody remembers them with a good praise).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and We gave them of Our Mercy and We appointed to them a truthful, highly sincere tongue,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And We gave them freely of Our mercy, and gave them a noble reputation of truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We gave them of Our mercy, and we made for them a reputation of high honor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:50] And We gave them, all three [of them], out of Our mercy, wealth and offspring, and We assigned for them a worthy repute [one] that is lofty, sublime, namely, [We assigned] fair praise [of them] among all the members of the [Abrahamic] religions.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And We gave them of Our mercy) We gave him of Our bounty a righteous son and a lawful property, (and assigned to them a high and true renown) We favoured them with being praised by others.
